world_news:
• [Nov 25, 6:43 AM] ICC Trial: Prosecutors at the International Criminal Court stated that a suspected Seleka militia leader in the Central African Republic had complete control over a prison where arbitrary detention and abuse of inmates occurred a decade ago.
  • [Nov 24, 11:18 PM] Venezuela Aviation: Venezuela's aviation institute has ordered international airlines to resume flights to the country within 48 hours, warning they risk losing their flight clearance if they fail to comply, according to the International Air Transport Association (IATA).
  • [Nov 24, 7:07 PM] Israel Economy: The Bank of Israel Governor, Amir Yaron, indicated that while economic conditions allowed for the first interest rate reduction in nearly two years, the pace of cuts will be slow, with only two more quarter-point reductions deemed 'reasonable' by September 2026.
  • [Nov 25, 3:33 AM] Nigeria Energy: Nigeria's Dangote Group has selected Honeywell to provide services aimed at doubling its petroleum refining capacity to 1.4 million barrels per day by 2028, a major step in its plan to become the world's largest refinery.
  • [Nov 24, 3:40 PM] US-China Diplomacy: President Donald Trump announced that he will visit Beijing in April 2026 and will host Chinaâ€™s President Xi Jinping for a state visit in the United States later that year.
  • [Nov 24, 7:05 AM] Honduras Election: Hondurans are facing a tense presidential election, which is being closely monitored internationally and is marred by heated accusations of fraud in one of Latin America's poorest nations.
us_news:
• [Nov 25, 1:21 PM] Domestic Politics/Legal: Several U.S. states have filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration to compel the reinstatement of over $3 billion in federal grant funding for homelessness programs.
  • [Nov 25, 12:54 PM] Domestic News/Health: Boar's Head Brand's supplier, Ambriola Company, has issued a Class I recall for pecorino cheese products due to potential Listeria contamination, which carries a risk of serious health consequences.
  • [Nov 25, 12:29 PM] Domestic Politics/Legal: The FBI has requested interviews with six Democratic U.S. lawmakers regarding a video message they released advising military members of their legal right to refuse unlawful orders.
  • [Nov 25, 11:50 AM] Economy: U.S. consumer confidence dropped in November, driven by worries over jobs and personal finances, with the recently ended federal government shutdown likely contributing to the decline.
  • [Nov 25, 11:16 AM] Domestic Politics/Economy: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated that President Trump is likely to announce his choice for the new U.S. Federal Reserve leader before Christmas, following a second round of interviews.
  • [Nov 25, 9:21 AM] Foreign Policy/Domestic Politics: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi reported a strong bond with U.S. President Donald Trump following their first phone call since a diplomatic dispute with China.
  • [Nov 24, 7:28 PM] Legal/Domestic Politics: A judicial misconduct complaint filed by the U.S. Department of Justice against a judge for alleged bias in a case challenging President Trump's transgender military ban has been dismissed.
tech_news:
• [Nov 25, 11:14 AM] AI/Tech: Fleet Space announced they found a massive lithium deposit in Quebec using a combination of AI and satellite technology.
  • [Nov 25, 11:00 AM] AI/Tech: Speechify released new voice typing and voice assistant capabilities for its Chrome extension, leveraging improved speech recognition models.
  • [Nov 24, 7:30 PM] AI/Venture: Google and Accel announced a new partnership to jointly invest up to $2 million in promising AI startups in India.
  • [Nov 24, 5:59 PM] AI/Tech: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman discussed the company's upcoming AI hardware device, stating it will be a "more peaceful and calm" computing experience than the iPhone.
  • [Nov 24, 2:10 PM] Tech/AI: AWS announced a $50 billion investment to build AI infrastructure specifically for the U.S. government.
  • [Nov 24, 2:08 PM] AI: Anthropic released Opus 4.5, the newest version of its flagship AI model, which includes new integrations for Chrome and Microsoft Excel.
financial_news:
• [Nov 25, 11:05 AM] Market Update: US stocks wavered on Tuesday as the tech sector pared earlier declines, with traders focused on the intensifying AI chip rivalry between Nvidia Corp. and Alphabet Inc. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 25, 7:01 AM] Technology/China: China's top tech companies are shifting their focus to developing AI agents as the next major battleground, signaling a new phase of competition in the artificial intelligence sector. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 24, 1:00 AM] Asset Management: A PwC report projects that private markets will account for over half of the money-management industry's revenues by 2030, driven by intense competition in private debt, equity, and infrastructure. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 24, 4:06 AM] European Economics: German business confidence unexpectedly dipped in November, according to the latest data, clouding the outlook for an economic rebound despite increased government spending. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 25, 2:00 AM] Geopolitics/Airlines: The Chinese government has reportedly instructed its airlines to extend flight reductions to Japan through March 2026, indicating a prolonged political and economic spat between the two nations. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 25, 5:00 AM] Commodities: Chilean copper producer Codelco is seeking a record-high annual premium for refined copper supplies to Chinese customers for 2026, driven by concerns that a rush of US shipments could cause a shortage elsewhere. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 24, 12:53 PM] Crypto/Fintech: Mike Novogratz's Galaxy Digital is in talks to become a liquidity provider for prediction market platforms Kalshi and Polymarket, signaling growing Wall Street interest in the emerging financial contract space. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 25, 6:39 AM] Central Banks/Macro: Global markets are awaiting a key consumer readout (likely consumer confidence or spending data) which will test hopes for a Federal Reserve pivot, with the dollar index steady to slightly lower in morning trading. (Source: Reuters)
  • [Nov 25, 5:40 AM] Tech Rivalry: Alphabet Inc.'s stock rally and advancements in its custom AI chips and Gemini model are positioning it as a serious rival to Nvidia Corp. in the highly lucrative AI accelerator market. (Source: Bloomberg)
  • [Nov 24, 11:37 PM] Economic Impact/Asia: Heavy rainfall has caused deadly floods across Southeast Asia, damaging crops and impacting tourism, which is expected to have a negative economic impact on the region's agricultural and travel sectors. (Source: Bloomberg)
